definition: Lasting for a very short time.
example: The beauty of the cherry blossoms is ephemeral.

definition: Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
example: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

definition: The occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
example: Discovering the old bookstore was pure serendipity.

definition: Brisk and cheerful readiness.
example: She accepted the invitation with alacrity.

definition: Pleasant and musical to hear.
example: The singer had a mellifluous voice.

definition: Intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge or interest.
example: The professor's lecture was full of esoteric references to ancient philosophy.

definition: Place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
example: The exhibition juxtaposes contemporary art with classical masterpieces.

definition: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
example: He was the quintessential tough guy—strong, silent, and self-contained.

definition: Kept secret, especially because it would not be approved of.
example: She had a surreptitious look at her watch.

definition: Using or expressed in more words than are needed.
example: His verbose explanation was difficult to follow.

definition: A thing belonging or appropriate to a period other than that in which it exists, especially a thing that is conspicuously old-fashioned.
example: The sword in the modern-day film was an anachronism.

definition: Well meaning and kindly.
example: A benevolent smile.

definition: Fond of company; sociable.
example: He was a popular and gregarious man.

definition: Reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little.
example: A shy, taciturn man, he was not inclined to talk about his work.

definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
example: An eloquent speech moved the audience to tears.

definition: Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
example: The pernicious influence of social media.

definition: Extremely idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
example: A quixotic attempt to end world hunger.

definition: Lacking enthusiasm and determination; carelessly lazy.
example: His lackadaisical attitude towards work was concerning.

definition: Make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
example: The new policy only exacerbated the existing tensions.

definition: A confusing and difficult problem or question.
example: The team faced a difficult conundrum.

definition: A countless or extremely great number.
example: There are a myriad of stars in the night sky.

definition: A large or excessive amount of something.
example: A plethora of options can be overwhelming.

definition: The art of effective or persuasive speaking or writing, especially the use of figures of speech and other compositional techniques.
example: The politician's speech was full of empty rhetoric.

definition: Make (something bad or unsatisfactory) better.
example: They tried to ameliorate the suffering of the victims.

definition: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
example: The weather was capricious, changing from sun to rain in minutes.

definition: A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.
example: The king was surrounded by sycophants.

definition: Too great or extreme to be expressed or described in words.
example: The ineffable beauty of the sunset.

definition: Cheerful and full of energy.
example: She was ebullient after receiving the good news.

definition: Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail.
example: He was fastidious in his attention to detail.

definition: A mode of behavior or way of thought peculiar to an individual.
example: One of his idiosyncrasies was always wearing a hat.

definition: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.
example: The garrulous old man told endless stories.

definition: Very generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or someone less powerful than oneself.
example: The magnanimous leader forgave his enemies.

definition: Render obscure, unclear, or unintelligible.
example: The politician tried to obfuscate the issue.

definition: Unwilling to spend money or use resources; stingy or frugal.
example: The parsimonious manager cut all unnecessary expenses.

definition: Having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority or discipline.
example: The recalcitrant child refused to obey.

definition: Health-giving; healthy.
example: The salubrious mountain air.

definition: Eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant.
example: His truculent attitude made him difficult to work with.

definition: A change of circumstances or fortune, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant.
example: The vicissitudes of life.

definition: A soft gentle breeze.
example: A zephyr rustled the leaves.

definition: The act of renouncing or rejecting something.
example: The abnegation of worldly pleasures.

definition: Demonstrating aggression and willingness to fight.
example: The bellicose nation was always ready for war.

definition: The use of many words where fewer would do, especially in a deliberate attempt to be vague or evasive.
example: He used circumlocution to avoid answering the question directly.

definition: Slow to act; intended to cause delay.
example: His dilatory tactics annoyed everyone.

definition: Cause (someone) to feel drained of energy or vitality; weaken.
example: The hot sun enervated the hikers.

definition: Treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humor; flippant.
example: His facetious remarks were not appreciated.

definition: A person who attacks cherished beliefs or institutions.
example: He was an iconoclast who challenged traditional views.

definition: The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect.
example: The juxtaposition of old and new architecture was striking.

definition: (Of a liquid) free of anything that darkens; completely clear.
example: The limpid waters of the lake.

definition: Self-pityingly or tearfully sentimental, often through drunkenness.
example: He became maudlin after a few drinks.

definition: (Typically of an action or activity) wicked or criminal.
example: The villain's nefarious plan.

definition: Stated or appearing to be true, but not necessarily so.
example: His ostensible reason for being there was work.

definition: (Of a treatment or medicine) relieving pain or alleviating a problem without dealing with the underlying cause.
example: Palliative care focuses on comfort.

definition: Complaining in a petulant or whining manner.
example: The querulous child constantly demanded attention.

definition: Not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily.
example: She was reticent about her past.

definition: Making a show of being morally superior to other people.
example: His sanctimonious attitude was off-putting.

definition: Very weak or slight.
example: The tenuous link between the two events.

definition: The fact of appearing everywhere or of being very common.
example: The ubiquity of plastic waste is a major concern.

definition: Alternate or waver between different opinions or actions; be indecisive.
example: He vacillated between the two job offers.

definition: (Of the moon) have a progressively smaller part of its visible surface illuminated, so that it appears to decrease in size.
example: The moon began to wane.

definition: Dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries.
example: Xenophobia can lead to social unrest.

definition: Have an intense feeling of longing for something, typically something that one has lost or been separated from.
example: She yearned for the return of her loved ones.

definition: Great enthusiasm and energy.
example: She had a zest for life.

definition: Accept something reluctantly but without protest.
example: He reluctantly acquiesced to their demands.

definition: Concise and exact use of words in writing or speech; shortness of time.
example: The brevity of his speech was appreciated.

definition: The quality of being open and honest in expression; frankness.
example: She spoke with candor about her experiences.
